groups.description: Climate change threatens our ability to ensure global food security, eradicate poverty and achieve sustainable development. Greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions from human activity and livestock are a significant driver of climate change, trapping heat in the earth's atmosphere and triggering global warming.
groups.name: climate-change-adaptation
groups.title: Climate change adaptation and resilience

organization.description: This research group is formed by professors and researchers from the University of Cantabria (UC, Dept. of Applied Mathematics and Computer Science) and the National Research Council (CSIC, Instituto de FÃ­sica de Cantabria IFCA), conducting research in topics related to weather forecast, climate research, data mining and high-performance computing, and spatiotemporal chaotic systems (see research lines and publications for more details, or download a brochure of the group). The group has participated in 12 EU-funded projects.
organization.title: Cantabria-Santander Meteorology Group
organization.name: cantabria-santander-meteorology-group

name: guidelines-mosaicc-climate-downscaling-component

resources.description: In the framework of the Modelling System for Agricultural Impacts of Climate Change, the downscaling tool and portal allow to bring General Circulation Models outputs (historical periods and future projections) to the spatial and temporal scales that are relevant for impact assessments. This tool has been developed and maintained by the University of Cantabria - Santander Meteorology Group, which also provides support for implementation and use in the countries.
resources.name: Statisical downscaling portal for MOSAICC. An end-to-end tool for regional imapct studies.

resources.description: In the framework of the Modelling System for Agricultural Impacts of Climate Change, the downscaling tool and portal allow to bring General Circulation Models outputs (historical periods and future projections) to the spatial and temporal scales that are relevant for impact assessments. This tool has been developed and maintained by the University of Cantabria - Santander Meteorology Group, which also provides support for implementation and use in the countries.
resources.name: Publication on climate downscaling by Santader Meteorology Group "Beyond ENSEMBLES: DA and SD Portals"

resources.description: Academic publicaiton descirbing the downscaling web portal which integrates the necessary tools with Grid middleware allowing for distributed data access and computing.TheportalispartoftheENSEMBLES EU-funded project and allows end users to interactively downscale weather predictions using a web browser. Both the architecture and the usage of the portal are described in this paper.
resources.name: A Web Portal for Regional Projection of Weather Forecast Using GRID Middleware

notes: In the framework of the MOSAICC, the downscaling tool and portal allow to bring General Circulation Models outputs (historical periods and future projections) to the spatial and temporal scales that are relevant for impact assessments. This tool has been developed and maintained by the University of Cantabria - Santander Meteorology Group, which also provides support for implementation and use in the countries.
title: Guidelines: MOSAICC climate downscaling component
